nodes.text: Moteé was a human female. She served as a member of the Naboo Royal Handmaidens protecting Padmé Amidala during the final days of the Clone Wars.
Moteé of Naboo was a human female who served as part of the Naboo Royal Handmaidens at the time of the Clone Wars.

During the conflict, she accompanied Senator Padmé Amidala and fellow Handmaiden Dormé on a diplomatic mission to the planet Clabron. Upon their arrival, they were ambushed by an assassin, with Moteé hit in the shoulder. They escaped inside the building, where Amidala was able to work out an agreement with the new minister. They then counter-ambushed the sniper, capturing her so they could return to Coruscant.

She attended the Senate meeting in which Supreme Chancellor Sheev Palpatine announced that the Galactic Republic was to be reorganized as the Galactic Empire. Moteé had brown hair, brown eyes, and fair skin. She was discreet, able to keep the secret of the relationship between Amidala and the Jedi Anakin Skywalker.
Moteé wore a short hooded mauve cape over a purple pleated dress.

Moteé was played by the Australian actress Kristy Wright in the 2005 film Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith, the final installment of the Star Wars prequel trilogy. The character's name was given in the film's closing credits.

In the Star Wars: The Prequel Trilogy – A Graphic Novel, the speech bubble with Palpatine's speech about the reorganization of the Galactic Republic into the Galactic Empire is directed towards her. This is most likely an error.
